sentences.en: A coin has two sides, a head and a tail.
An old coin was dug up in the garden.
sentences.cn: 在花园里挖出了一枚古硬币.

sentences.en: Coin-operated telephones took 100, 200 and 500 lire coins.
sentences.cn: 投币电话接受100，200和500里拉的硬币。

sentences.en: I had to find out the hard way—to coin a phrase.
sentences.cn: 套句老话说，我是费了九牛二虎之力才搞清楚的。

sentences.en: I put the coin in the machine and pulled the lever.
sentences.cn: 我把硬币投入机器，拉动控制杆。

sentences.en: I took a coin out of my purse and gave it to the child.
sentences.cn: 我从钱包取出一枚硬币给那个小孩。

sentences.en: Put a coin in the slot.
She pressed a coin into the little girl's hand.
sentences.cn: 她把一枚硬币塞到小姑娘的手里.

sentences.en: The coin has a crowned lion on its reverse.
sentences.cn: 这枚硬币反面的图案是个戴皇冠的狮子.

sentences.en: The coin rolled underneath the piano.
The golden rule is never to clean a valuable coin.
sentences.cn: 重要的原则是决不清除贵重硬币上的污垢。

sentences.en: The Royal Mint will strike a gold coin of commemorative.
sentences.cn: 英国皇家造币厂将铸造一种纪念金币.

sentences.en: The two boys agreed to decide the matter by tossing a coin.
sentences.cn: 这两个孩子同意用掷硬币的方法来决定这件事.

sentences.en: The word ‘aromatherapy’ was coined in the 1920s. aromatherapy
sentences.cn: （芳香疗法）这个词是在20世纪20年代创造出来的。

sentences.en: They flipped a coin to decide who would go first.
sentences.cn: 他们用掷硬币的方法决定谁先去.

sentences.en: Thirteen per cent of Christie's coin and banknote auction went unsold.
sentences.cn: 佳士得13%的硬币和纸币拍卖流拍。

sentences.en: Toss a coin to see who goes first.

words.tran_cn: 造币；[金融] 货币制度；新造的字及其语等
创造者；伪造货币者；造币者

phrases.tran_cn: 装硬币的钱包；钱包；零钱袋

phrases.phrase: pay someone back in their own coin
phrases.tran_cn: 以其人之道，还治其人之身

phrases.phrase: the other side of the coin
phrases.tran_cn: 反面，反面意见：两个不同的或相反的观点和方面之一
抛硬币决定问题；掷硬币猜正反面的赌博

trans.tran_en: a piece of metal, usually flat and round, that is used as money

trans.tran_cn: 创造（新词语），很快地赚（钱）
trans.tran_en: to invent a new word or expression, especially one that many people start to use
